intro: Acrospira curtisiae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant worldwide.
